definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Firn is too big, the person that winds some is very sad without ticket.
sentences.chinese: 積雪太大，回有的的人沒有車票好難過。

sentences.english: The train conductor punched my ticket.
sentences.chinese: 火車檢票員在我的車票上軋洞。

sentences.english: Of course, I've booked the train tickets now. And Tom's looking forward to it.
sentences.chinese: 當然了，我已經訂了火車票了，而且湯姆也很期待。

sentences.english: Next stop is Ping Shan. The end of Zone 4 for single-ride ticket.
sentences.chinese: 下一站系屏山，單程車票第四收費區終止。

sentences.english: Her wallet stolen, she had no money to buy even a bus ticket.
sentences.chinese: 因爲錢包被偷了，她甚至連買車票的錢也沒有了。

sentences.english: Next stop is Tin Wing, zone 4 for single-ride ticket.
sentences.chinese: 下一站系天榮，屬單程車票第四收費區。

sentences.english: I take the train to go to work this morning and the conductor did not want to take my train ticket.
sentences.chinese: 今晨我程火車上班，車掌先生不要剪我的車票。

sentences.english: Jiang Kai countries after the surgery, bought a ticket to go home immediately.
sentences.chinese: 江開國在手術以後，自己買了車票要立即回家。

sentences.english: I got a second-class ticket on the train to New York.
sentences.chinese: 我弄到一張去紐約的二等艙火車票。

sentences.english: Could you get me two tickets for tomorrow here?
sentences.chinese: 你能否在這兒賣給我兩張來日誥日的車票？

sentences.english: Next stop is Chestwood, zone 4 for single-ride ticket.
sentences.chinese: 下一站系翠湖，屬單程車票第四收費區。

sentences.english: I got a second-class ticket on the train to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我有張去巴黎的二等火車票。

sentences.english: We are booked through to New York.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經訂好了去紐約的全程車票。

sentences.english: The ticket collector used a puncher to check the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 收票員用打洞器檢查車票。

sentences.english: She followed him to the platform, standing back while he bought tickets.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他到了月臺，站在後面，而他在買車票。

sentences.english: They have booked two tickets through to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他們訂購了兩張直達北京的車票。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
to place an order/to book ahead
to set off/to start (on a journey)
